  77 -def show_if(cond): 

  78      if not cond: 
  79          return None 
  80      base = "%s_%s" % (cond.first.tablename, cond.first.name) 
  81      if ((cond.op.__name__ == 'EQ' and cond.second == True) or 
  82          (cond.op.__name__ == 'NE' and cond.second == False)): 
  83          return base,":checked" 
  84      if ((cond.op.__name__ == 'EQ' and cond.second == False) or 
  85          (cond.op.__name__ == 'NE' and cond.second == True)): 
  86          return base,":not(:checked)" 
  87      if cond.op.__name__ == 'EQ': 
  88          return base,"[value='%s']" % cond.second 
  89      if cond.op.__name__ == 'NE': 
  90          return base,"[value!='%s']" % cond.second 
  91      if cond.op.__name__ == 'CONTAINS': 
  92          return base,"[value~='%s']" % cond.second 
  93      if cond.op.__name__ == 'BELONGS' and isinstance(cond.second,(list,tuple)): 
  94          return base,','.join("[value='%s']" % (v) for v in cond.second) 
  95      raise RuntimeError("Not Implemented Error")

 575      @staticmethod 

 576 -    def is_image(value): 

 577          """ 
 578          Tries to check if the filename provided references to an image 
 579   
 580          Checking is based on filename extension. Currently recognized: 
 581             gif, png, jp(e)g, bmp 
 582   
 583          :param value: filename 
 584          """ 
 585

1883          def fetch_count(dbset): 
1884              ##FIXME for google:datastore cache_count is ignored 
1885              ## if it's not an integer 
1886              if cache_count is None or isinstance(cache_count, tuple): 
1887                  if groupby: 
1888                      c = 'count(*)' 
1889                      nrows = db.executesql( 
1890                          'select count(*) from (%s) _tmp;' % 
1891                          dbset._select(c, left=left, cacheable=True, 
1892                                        groupby=groupby, 
1893                                        cache=cache_count)[:-1])[0][0] 
1894                  elif left: 
1895                      c = 'count(*)' 
1896                      nrows = dbset.select(c, left=left, cacheable=True, cache=cache_count).first()[c] 
1897                  elif dbset._db._adapter.dbengine=='google:datastore': 
1898                      #if we don't set a limit, this can timeout for a large table 
1899                      nrows = dbset.db._adapter.count(dbset.query, limit=1000) 
1900                  else: 
1901                      nrows = dbset.count(cache=cache_count) 
1902              elif isinstance(cache_count, (int, long)): 
1903                      nrows = cache_count 
1904              elif callable(cache_count): 
1905                  nrows = cache_count(dbset, request.vars) 
1906              else: 
1907                  nrows = 0 
1908              return nrows

1910          def url(**b): 
1911              b['args'] = args + b.get('args', []) 
1912              localvars = request.get_vars.copy() 
1913              localvars.update(b.get('vars', {})) 
1914              b['vars'] = localvars 
1915              b['hash_vars'] = False 
1916              b['user_signature'] = user_signature 
1917              return URL(**b)

1925              b['user_signature'] = user_signature 
1926              return URL(**b)

2037              lst[i:i] = x
